rules.text: Projects must reforest lands without forest cover since 31 December 1989 and comply with national definitions.
Baseline biomass is determined using IPCC default factors or site-specific sampling following Tool 02 guidance.
Net anthropogenic GHG removals equal project removals minus baseline emissions and leakage.
Activity shifting leakage is quantified using Tool 14 and discounted from net removals.
Non-permanence risk must be addressed through buffer contributions consistent with Tool 15 guidance.
Field measurements of biomass stock changes occur at least every five years with permanent plots.
If sampling uncertainty exceeds 10%, apply Tool 12 to derive conservative estimates.
Monitoring reports include maps, inventory data, leakage deductions, and QA/QC evidence.
